title: How to Be the Best You Can Be

steps.title: What do you really want to do with your life?
steps.content: What do you really want to do with your life? Maybe you want to get your dream job and live across the globe. Maybe you want to have kids and settle down in a big house in the country. Maybe you want to become an artist and share your craft with the world. Whatever it is, you should keep it at the forefront of your mind as you go along the path to be the best you can be. [1] X Research source Not everyone has a dream or a huge goal in life, and that’s okay. Your dream might be becoming financially stable and living a happy life. Whatever works for you is what you should strive toward. Pursuing your dreams won’t happen in a day, and that’s okay. However, if you identify what your overarching goal is, you can break it down into smaller ones and work toward it over time.

steps.title: Make them specific and actionable so you know you can meet them.
steps.content: Make them specific and actionable so you know you can meet them. Sit down and write out a list of things you’d like to get done in the next few months or years. For example, going to the dentist twice a year is a specific and achievable goal. On the other hand, improving your health is too broad and vague. [2] X Research source You could also have goals like, “Go running twice a week,” “Apply for a new job by the end of the year,” or “Spend time with family members at least once a month.”

steps.title: When you feel good physically, you’ll feel good emotionally.
steps.content: When you feel good physically, you’ll feel good emotionally. Take control of your health by sticking to a balanced diet, getting enough rest, and exercising regularly. Drink a lot of water to stay hydrated, and visit the doctor to take care of any underlying health problems you might have. [3] X Research source Being healthy doesn’t necessarily mean you need to lose weight or get ripped. It just means that you feel good in your body and you’re confident in your own physical wellbeing.

steps.title: Lower your stress levels with a bit of pampering.
steps.content: Lower your stress levels with a bit of pampering. Self-care doesn’t have to mean a luxurious bubble bath or spa day—you can try meditating, doing yoga, going for a run, or reading a good book. Try to do something every day that makes you feel good simply because you like it. [4] X Research source You could also try journaling, painting, listening to new music, taking a nature walk, or playing with a pet.

steps.title: You can also say no to things that don’t make you happy.
steps.content: You can also say no to things that don’t make you happy. Only put things on your to-do list that you actually have the time (and the will) to do. If you have more work than you can handle, you’ll probably feel overwhelmed and stretched thin. [5] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Business Review Online and print journal covering topics related to business management practices Go to source For example, if your child's teacher requests that you direct the school Christmas play but you know that you are especially busy at Christmas time, feel confident saying “no.”

steps.title: New experiences make you feel better about life.
steps.content: New experiences make you feel better about life. Visit a new country that you’ve been dying to go to. When you get out and explore the world, you’re going to feel more well-rounded. Try not to let the fear of the unknown stop you from any opportunity. [6] X Research source Trying new things can be intimidating, but it’s important to push yourself outside of your comfort zone.

steps.title: What’s something you’re not super great at?
steps.content: What’s something you’re not super great at? Maybe you get nervous about public speaking or you aren’t the best driver. Make it a goal to better yourself and turn your weaknesses into strengths instead of hindrances. [7] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Business Review Online and print journal covering topics related to business management practices Go to source For example, if you’re nervous about public speaking, you could take a public speaking class to practice. If you aren’t the best cook, buy a few cookbooks and look up tutorials online for some basic recipes.

steps.title: Track your progress as you grow.
steps.content: Track your progress as you grow. Set aside 10 to 15 minutes every day to jot down how you’re feeling, what you did that day, and what you’re excited about. It’s okay if you skip a day or two here or there—try to keep the habit up as much as you can. [8] X Research source After a couple of months, look back and read some old entries that you made. You might be surprised at how far you’ve come.

steps.title: You’re going to fail every now and then, and that’s okay.
steps.content: You’re going to fail every now and then, and that’s okay. If you mess up or stumble, take a moment to think about what you learned. In the future, you can use your lesson to avoid the same mistakes and stay on the right path. [9] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Business Review Online and print journal covering topics related to business management practices Go to source For example, maybe you applied for a promotion in your workplace and you didn’t get it. You might have learned that you need more on-the-job experience before applying to a management position. Or, maybe you went back to school and failed one of your classes. Now you know how to manage your time better and that you need to dedicate more time to studying.

steps.title: Well-meaning criticism can help you improve your life.
steps.content: Well-meaning criticism can help you improve your life. It’s easy to get defensive or be offended when you hear something negative about yourself—however, try to use it as a learning opportunity. If someone means well and they’re trying to help you, consider taking what they said as an opportunity to learn and grow. [10] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Business Review Online and print journal covering topics related to business management practices Go to source For example, your boss might tell you that your presentation lacked conviction. You can use that criticism to make your next one more personal and convincing.

steps.title: Being an optimist means looking at the bright side of things.
steps.content: Being an optimist means looking at the bright side of things. If you keep a positive attitude, you can reduce your stress and improve your outlook on life. If you catch yourself thinking something negative, challenge it with a positive thought. [11] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source For example, if you catch yourself thinking, “I’ve never done this before,” replace it with, “This is a good opportunity to learn.” Or, if you catch yourself thinking, “There’s no way this will work,” try thinking, “I can try to make this work.”

steps.title: Find friends and family members who will support your journey.
steps.content: Find friends and family members who will support your journey. If you admire them and think they’re good role models, they’re probably good people. If you find yourself getting down or thinking negatively after spending time with someone, it might be time to reevaluate the relationship. [12] X Trustworthy Source HelpGuide Nonprofit organization dedicated to providing free, evidence-based mental health and wellness resources. Go to source You might also consider why you admire certain people. What qualities do they possess that you would like to have? You can try to incorporate them into your daily life.

steps.title: Our relationships can define who we are.
steps.content: Our relationships can define who we are. Just like you’d want your friends to be kind to you, you should aim to be loving and supportive toward them. Be a shoulder to lean on, push them to achieve their goals, and lift them up in times of stress. [13] X Research source Think about someone in your life who’s been there for you. Try to emulate them when you talk to your loved ones.
